verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764> on Neginoth <WH5058>, A Psalm <WH4210> or Song <WH7892> of Asaph <WH623>. In Y'hudah <WH3063> is 'Elohim <WH430> known <WH3045> <WH8737>: his name <WH8034> is great <WH1419> in Yisra'EL <WH3478>.
In Shalem <WH8004> also is his tabernacle <WH5520>, and his dwelling place <WH4585> in TZiyon <WH6726>.
There brake <WH7665> <WH8765> he the arrows <WH7565> of the bow <WH7198>, the shield <WH4043>, and the sword <WH2719>, and the battle <WH4421>. Selah <WH5542>.
Thou art more glorious <WH215> <WH8737> and excellent <WH117> than the mountains <WH2042> of prey <WH2964>.

The stouthearted <WH47> <WH3820> are spoiled <WH7997> <WH8709>, they have slept <WH5123> <WH8804> their sleep <WH8142>: and none of the men <WH582> of might <WH2428> have found <WH4672> <WH8804> their hands <WH3027>.
At thy rebuke <WH1606>, O 'Elohim <WH430> of Ya`akov <WH3290>, both the chariot <WH7393> and horse <WH5483> are cast into a dead sleep <WH7290> <WH8737>.
Thou, even thou, art to be feared <WH3372> <WH8737>: and who may stand <WH5975> <WH8799> in thy sight <WH6440> when <WH227> once thou art angry <WH639> ?
Thou didst cause judgment <WH1779> to be heard <WH8085> <WH8689> from heaven <WH8064>; the earth <WH776> feared <WH3372> <WH8804>, and was still <WH8252> <WH8804>,
When 'Elohim <WH430> arose <WH6965> <WH8800> to judgment <WH4941>, to save <WH3467> <WH8687> all the meek <WH6035> of the earth <WH776>. Selah <WH5542>.
Surely the wrath <WH2534> of man <WH120> shall praise <WH3034> <WH8686> thee: the remainder <WH7611> of wrath <WH2534> shalt thou restrain <WH2296> <WH8799>.

Vow <WH5087> <WH8798>, and pay <WH7999> <WH8761> unto the YY <WH3068> your 'Elohim <WH430>: let all that be round about <WH5439> him bring <WH2986> <WH8686> presents <WH7862> unto him that ought to be feared <WH4172>.
He shall cut off <WH1219> <WH8799> the spirit <WH7307> of princes <WH5057>: he is terrible <WH3372> <WH8737> to the kings <WH4428> of the earth <WH776>.
